3: I see the tower!
Start the reboot sequence!
Purifying rod is... still usable. Functionality is at... 37%. That's more than enough.
All systems green. Rebooting filter now!
...Did it work?
Aside from the residual hums within the central purification filter chamber, you do not feel any differences.
The Corrupted are retreating... Did it work, Commandant?
Now then, only one thing left to do...
The mainframe of the control center is here.
If the engies are renovating this place, this kid'll have to be shut off first.
Cosmos Industries MSC-43B. In service for ■■■■■ days.
Log: ■■/■■/■■■■. Registered large quantities of unidentified hostile entities. Modified functions to protect evacuating humans.
Log: ■■/■■/■■■■. Partial withdrawal of unidentified hostile entities due to high-frequency signal broadcast from coordinates: ■■■.
Log: ■■/■■/■■■■. To sustain current functionality, Emergency Protocol 331A has been executed. All external ports disconnected.
What a champ... Even popping 331A...
Control Logs: This terminal has been running ■■■■■ days past standard operation limits.
The logs are overflowin' too... Commandant, shut it down already.
Even machines need rest. And this boyo deserves one more than any other.
System shutdown... confirmed.
Cosmos Industries... Excellence and reliability in design...
Man, they need to pay you more for this. 'Reliability in design', huh... Guess that's not just sales talk.
That's one hell of an overtime... Sleep tight, sweet prince.
Hello? Do you copy? According to the reports from the nearby task force squads, most of the Corrupted around the filter chamber should be exterminated.
Engineering and Support Forces are en route.
Good work, everyone. Take five. We'll send you the intel for the next area later.
